intro: Cracca polystachya, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red-orange flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes other milkweeds known for their milky sap. Cracca polystachya thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical regions. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees, making it an important plant in ecological gardens.
